main event: A yellowish, round object was observed in the sky over Atlanta, Georgia on September 29, 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed for 7-8 seconds and was described as larger than a star, with a yellowish color.
The object was reported to have made normal maneuvers.

A second sighting of two objects was reported by another witness in the Atlanta area on the same day. The objects were observed for 15 minutes, appearing to be 10 feet apart but likely much farther apart due to the great distance.
The second sighting was described as round objects that changed color from light blue to bright red, moving slowly but likely at a fast actual speed due to the great distance.
The objects in the second sighting were observed from Peachtree Road, about 5-6 miles north of Atlanta, moving southwest.
sighted object: yellowish, round object; two round objects changing color from light blue to bright red
witnesses: multiple witnesses, including a pilot and aircraft controller
